# Textbook RSA

**This is an educational implementation of RSA and not fit for any use!**

You can use this small snippet to experiment with RSA in Haskell.

# Example

```Haskell
do
  k <- generatePair 2048
  let c = encryptascii "secret message" $ pubkey k
  print $ decryptascii c $ privkey k
```

Should again print `secret message`!

# Interactive Terminal

There's also an interactive terminal that you can use in this manner:

```
> Help
Generate
LoadKeyPair
LoadPubKey
Encrypt
Decrypt
Quit
Help
> Generate
(Public Exponent, Private Exponent, Public Modulus)
(65537,,)
> Encrypt
Hello World!

> Decrypt

< Hello World!
> 
```

Note that because there is no padding encryption of the same plaintext will always yield the same ciphertext.
